intro: Orbea wissmannii subsp. wissmannii, commonly known as the Wissmann's orbea, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, cylindrical stems and clusters of tubular flowers. The plant produces striking, often brightly colored blooms in shades of red, yellow, and orange. It is adapted to arid environments and requires well-draining soil and minimal water. Orbea wissmannii subsp. wissmannii is popular among succulent enthusiasts for its ornamental value and resilience.
